fields.description:
Issue is – MOC application is opening in Window mode and TOSCA is unable to recognize this window. Below are the steps in detail: 

(1) Browse and Login to application – https://amlcase-sit.bankofamerica.com
Login using window id and password
(2) Application will be opened as tool (Window) mode (Not browser mode)
(3) When we try to scan application using Xscan, TOSCA is not identifying this window as a browser.
(4) Temporary work around is – Once application opened then click CNTRL+N (Control N) – Application will be opened in browser mode. 
(5) Once application is opened in browser mode then TOSCA is able to scan using XSCAN.
(6) Question is – Is there any setting/option in TOSCA to scan browser based application when it opens as tool (window) but not as browser? We have asked developer to send piece of code regarding how it open application in window mode, but I don’t think development team will make change to open application in browser mode as this required discussion with business where they are using this application since more than 5 years and used to this.
fields.summary: Application is opening in tool (window) mode and TOSCA is unable to scan identify applicaiton using Xscan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Epic Burndown shows incorrect sprint information for Main Board but specific team board shows correct sprint.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.4, JIRA 6.4.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a project call TEST
# Create a custom field (text field) call Team.
# Create two filters:
{code}
Team A: JQL: project = TEST and Team = A
Team B: JQL: project = TEST and Team = B
{code}
# Assign Team A value to TEST-1
# Assign Team B value to TEST-2
# Create two issues TEST-1 and TEST-2
# Create two board Team A and Team B and use the Team A and B filters.
# Create a board by including Team A and Team B with the JQL query (project = TEST)
# Create an Epic call Team AB and link TEST-1 and TEST-2 together.
# Add a sprint for Team A and B board with different name.
# Set a story point to TEST-1 and TEST-2
# Transit TEST-1 and TEST-2 to Done.
# Ended the two Sprint and view the Epic Burndown chart 
# You will see under *Completed Issues* shows only one Sprint even though.

h3. Expected Results

The issues are shown under right sprint in all boards.

 !Bug01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Some issues are shown in wrong sprint under the Main Project board.

 !Bug02.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

For now there's no workaround
fields.summary: Issue shown incorrectly in Epic Burndown when multiple Project boards are used

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Release Burndown is showing data based on the timestamp with association between change items and Sprint. Below scenario will help to explain it:
# Have a project and board
# Create Sprint 1 and Story A
# Assign Story A to Sprint 1 and start this Sprint
# In Backlog, create Story B and also version 1
# Add estimation to Story B, assign it to version 1 and complete it.
# Notice that in Release Burndown, it displays Sprint 1 even Story B never get assigned to Sprint 1

Second scenario:
# Have a project and board
# Create Version 1
# Create Sprint 1 and Sprint 2
# Create Story A and add estimate
# Assign Story A to Sprint 1 and start this Sprint
# Remove Story A from Sprint 1 and assign it to Sprint 2
# Remove Story A from Sprint 2 
# Assign Story A to Version 1 and complete this Story
# Notice that Release Burndown shows Sprint 1 even Story A doesn't belong to this Sprint anymore when it's complete.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Improve the way Release Burndown displays data by adding some checking if a Story belongs to certain Sprint. If it doesn't belong to any Sprint, the current Sprint should not be shown into this report.
fields.summary: Improve the way Release Burndown shows data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When having an agile board with multiple statuses (transitions) in a column, the order of the statuses when drag-and-dropping, follows the "random" order for which the transitions where created.

The order should follow either the order specified under *configure board->columns* or the opsbar-sequence defined in the workflow transitions. Properbly it makes most sense with the opsbar-sequence, as it is actually transitions showing and not statuses. But it would be nice if it could be configured on the board and not in the workflow.

As it is now, the only way to change the order of the statuses, is by deleting the transitions in the workflow, and creating them again in the correct order. Which basically means creating the workflow all over again.

I have attached screenshots of the actually behaviour on the board, the board config and the workflow transitions. The opsbar-sequence is *Ready for test=10*, *Resolve=40* and *Close=60*.
fields.summary: statusorder within a column

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Would like to be able to group all of my Epics for a certain feature together into one bucket

h3. Suggested Solution

For example:

Overall Feature: Feature 1
20 Epics, where each Epic has 20 - 30 User Stories, and each User Story has 5 - 10 subtasks.

Overall Feature: Feature 2
15 Epics, where each Epic has 10 User Stories, and each User Story has 5 - 8 subtasks.

Overall Feature: Feature 3

17 Epics, where each Epic has 12 User Stories, and each User Story has 8 - 12 subtasks.

In this case, Epic, Story, and Story Subtask are all existing JIRA issues. End user would like to create a bucket of a JIRA issue containing all of the overall Epics: Feature 1, Feature 2 and Feature 3
 
h3. Workaround 

Third-party add-on that add this functionality to JIRA here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.almworks.jira.structure/server/overview. Unfortunately, it is only available for JIRA Server.

End user could as separate Feature 1, Feature 2 and Feature 3 their own separate projects. Then create a saved JQL filter to search for all Epics in project. Setup a JQL filter to search for all Epics in project Feature 1. Will not update systematically as JQL filter will need to be changed everything new Epic is added to Feature 1. 

Another possible workaround would be for the end user to create a multi-project agile board governed by epic swimlanes. Create board title Feature 1 and manually configure the board filter to contains all 20 Epics in Feature 1. Will not automatically update when you create additional Epics for Feature 1 as the JQL board configuration will need to be adjusted
fields.summary: Ability to create Epic buckets for overall features that contain Epics, Stories and Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Agile Backlog doesn't show issues in the correct sprints. Moving issues to sprints reverts back after refreshing the page.
h3. Cause

*The scenario mentioned below is only an example of the scenario where this issue occurs. There could be more causes for this problem. We are working on our side on identifying more causes.*
 # The index is not reindexing changes to the Sprint correctly because there is, or used to be, another field called "Sprint" with a different data type.
 Because the Backlog uses the index, although the issues are correctly modified on the backend, they are displayed incorrectly on the boards.
 # There are reports that customers on JIRA 7.2 have run into this despite not having another "Sprint" field. Exact cause is still unknown.

Check if affected:

This DB query returns issues affected by this:
{code:SQL}select p.pkey ||'-'|| i.issuenum as key, ci.field, ci.newvalue, ci.newstring from changegroup cg join changeitem ci on cg.id = ci.groupid left join jiraissue i on cg.issueid = i.id left join project p on i.project = p.id where ci.field = 'Sprint' and newvalue is NULL;
{code}
For MySQL use:
{code:SQL}
select  CONCAT(p.pkey, "-", i.issuenum)AS 'Issue key', ci.field, ci.newvalue, ci.newstring from changegroup cg join changeitem ci on cg.id = ci.groupid left join jiraissue i on cg.issueid = i.id left join project p on i.project = p.id where ci.field = 'Sprint' and newvalue is NULL;
{code}

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Software Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Field type "labels" and name it "Sprint"
 # On a certain issue add a label and remove a label
 # On the backlog view, move that issue to a different sprint

(!) There are reports that customers on JIRA 7.2 have run into this despite not having another "Sprint" field. Exact cause is still unknown.
h3. Expected Results

Issue is correctly moved between sprints and changes persist.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is dragged over to the sprint.
 The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log: {{Error indexing issue}}
{noformat}2016-04-11 10:52:07.559050500 2016-04-11 10:52:07,548 http-nio-3000-exec-10 WARN sysadmin 652x1263x1 9aomkb 103.233.242.8 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/rank [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Error indexing issue BDBPP-145: Dropping 'customfield_10402'

2016-04-11 10:52:07.559176500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-04-11 10:52:07.559176500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
2016-04-11 10:52:07.559182500 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy11.release(Unknown Source)
2016-04-11 10:52:07.559183500 	... 3 filtered
{noformat}
A refresh of the backlog shows the issue back on the previous location.
h3. Notes

The problem is related to historic events. It will only affect issues that have the duplicate "Sprint" field cleared in the past. New issues where labels weren't modified, won't have the problem.
h3. Workaround

*Please be aware that unfortunately the workaround here is temporary and the issue comes back after some time*

(!) Always generate backup of your database before making any changes to it via SQL. Any workaround requiring SQL changes carries inherent risk so a backup of your DB is essential to restore working conditions if there is a critical problem. This workaround should be tested in a clone of your Production environment prior to attempting it in Production.
 # Backup all the "sprint-removal history items" into a separate table, and remove them from the initial table
{code:java}create table changeitem_quarantine_jira721 as
select ci.* from changeitem ci
where ci.field = 'Sprint'
and   ci.newvalue is null;
{code}
 # Remove them from the initial {{changeitem}} table:
{code:java}DELETE from changeitem ci where ci.id in (select id from changeitem_quarantine_jira721);
{code}
 # Restart JIRA
 # Full/Locked reindexing

If any misbehaviour happens, the records can be restored again with the statement:
{code:java}insert into changeitem
select * from changeitem_quarantine_jira721 where id not in (select id from changeitem);
{code}
fields.summary: Backlog doesn't show issues in the correct sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA Software, when accessing the Version Report the product does not currently sort the issues in a logical fashion within the tables. As a result, the order of the issues presented is unpredictable. This is inconsistant behaviour as other reports do show items in at least some form of sorted order.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.1.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Software Project with a Version. 
# Create some issues. 
# Modify these issues randomly.
# Review the Version Report. 
# Observe the issues are not sorted.

h3. Expected Results

Sorted issues in the version report, similar to how the Sprint report functions.

h3. Actual Results

The Issues are not displayed in an ordered fashion.

h3. Workaround

To order the issues, use the "View in Issue Navigator" link to view the issues, from the Issue navigator, the issues can be sorted as desired.
fields.summary: Version Report should show issues in a sorted order

fields.description:
REST API is update issue: PUT /rest/api/latest/issue
Before 7.1 the Sprint custom field (com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint) requires a string value representing the id of the sprint. 
On 7.1, setting the value to a number or string id gives a internal server error with java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String
On 7.2 a numeric is expected: Number value expected as the Sprint id

REST API should be upward compatible and support both numeric and string forms.  

In both cases the field has metadata with string item type
{noformat}
Name  . . . . . . . . . . . . : Sprint
Description . . . . . . . . . : 
Required  . . . . . . . . . . : false
Has default . . . . . . . . . : false
Has allowed values  . . . . . : false
Type  . . . . . . . . . . . . : array
Item type . . . . . . . . . . : string
Custom  . . . . . . . . . . . : true
Custom type . . . . . . . . . : com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint
{noformat}
fields.summary: Incompatible change in behavior of REST API Sprint field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As mentioned by the developer in this JRA-59832 ticket:
{quote}Unfortunately it was becoming too difficult to maintain older upgrade tasks, so in 7.1.0 the Agile team removed upgrade tasks older than 12 months.
You can either
Upgrade JIRA Agile to 6.7.x on their original instance (for JIRA 6.3, 6.4 and 6.5). Or;
Import the data into a JIRA Software 7.0.0 instance first. (or upgrade the original instance to 7.0.0)
Both of these scenarios will run the required upgrade tasks.{quote}

So currently,when user want to take "Roll back" action, he must prepare
# backup of JIRA Installation Directory
# backup of JIRA HOME directory
# backup of JIRA Database directory
So if user missed those backups, user can't take this action.
User can notice after upgrade by atlassian-jira.log because no error/warning on before upgrade process.(https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60371)

In 7.1.4, there are 
{code}
(ghUpgradeTask046)	Assign status categories to Agile Simplified Workflow statuses.
(ghUpgradeTask047)	Remove classic gadget
(ghUpgradeTask048)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field searching
(ghUpgradeTask049)	Migration Manage Sprints permission
(ghUpgradeTask050)	Re-migration Manage Sprints permission
(ghUpgradeTask051)	Migration Manage Sprints permission for BTF customers only
{code}

And in 7.0.10,
{code}
(ghUpgradeTask003)	Moves some preferences values to settings
(ghUpgradeTask004)	Layout Keys Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask007)	Flag Field Value Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask008)	Listener Removal Upgrade Task
(ghUpgradeTask009)	GreenHopper Nightservice cleanup Task
(ghUpgradeTask010)	Custom Field Reindex Message
(ghUpgradeTask011)	Custom Field Reindex Message
(ghUpgradeTask012)	Labs Ranking Migration
(ghUpgradeTask013)	Ranking Migration
(ghUpgradeTask014)	Introduction of UpgradeVersionService
(ghUpgradeTask015)	Migrating Sprint data from PropertySets back into AO
(ghUpgradeTask016)	Migrating RapidView data from PropertySets back into AO
(ghUpgradeTask017)	Setting default Estimation Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask018)	Setting default Estimation Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask019)	Setting sprint field reindex required message
(ghUpgradeTask020)	Setting default swimlane strategy for boards
(ghUpgradeTask021)	Setting default Tracking Statistic configuration for boards
(ghUpgradeTask022)	Attempt to create Sprint custom field as Scrum is no longer a 'Labs' feature
(ghUpgradeTask023)	Setting default card color strategy for boards
(ghUpgradeTask024)	Fixes default sprint marker names in the database
(ghUpgradeTask025)	Renames the Epic Label field to Epic Name
(ghUpgradeTask026)	Adds custom fields for Epic support
(ghUpgradeTask027)	Updating epic status custom field value based on the current resolution of the epic
(ghUpgradeTask029)	Modifying change history items for Epic Link field to include issue ID
(ghUpgradeTask030)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field
(ghUpgradeTask031)	Migrate default issue details fields into configuration
(ghUpgradeTask032)	Updating stored usernames to work with JIRA 6.0 rename user feature
(ghUpgradeTask033)	Merge data from duplicated custom fields of managed GreenHopper custom fields
(ghUpgradeTask034)	Add epic link custom field to default screen
(ghUpgradeTask035)	Update searcher type for Flagged custom field
(ghUpgradeTask036)	Set started flag of existing sprints to true
(ghUpgradeTask037)	Renamed custom fields and work flows for JIRA Agile
(ghUpgradeTask038)	Reset Analytics opt in values
(ghUpgradeTask039)	Upgrade Rapid View owners to Board Admins
(ghUpgradeTask040)	Reset custom field names
(ghUpgradeTask041)	Update epic color to the new palette
(ghUpgradeTask042)	Add sprint field to view/create/edit issue screens
(ghUpgradeTask043)	Force Sprint Marker Migration
(ghUpgradeTask044)	Migrate to lexo rank
(ghUpgradeTask045)	Remove 'Rank (Obsolete)' custom fields
(ghUpgradeTask046)	Assign status categories to Agile Simplified Workflow statuses.
(ghUpgradeTask047)	Remove classic gadget.
(ghUpgradeTask048)	Inserts a reindex required warning into the admin screen for the epic label custom field searching
(ghUpgradeTask049)	Upgrade task to bring build number in sync with cloud
(ghUpgradeTask050)	Upgrade task to bring build number in sync with cloud
{code}

Error message shows us that 
# JIRA 6.3.15&JIRA Agile 6.3.13 is "ghUpgradeTask042"
# JIRA Software 7.1.x starts its upgrade task from "ghUpgradeTask045"

So ghUpgradeTasks from 043 to 044 are removed.


h3. Suggested Solution
Publish some document or script to do JIRA Agile upgrade task that removed by the development team. The documentation should include about the things such like DB tables/record that are changed by these upgradetask. This would be easier than performing the rollback process.
fields.summary: Documentation/Script request on the removed Jira Agile Upgrade Task

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an Issue closed in another Sprint is Re-Opened, it is added to the Backlog of the Scrum Board.  Unless the user who re-opens the issue remembers to move the re-opened issue, it may get lost in the backlog 

h3. Suggested Solution
Automatically add the ReOpened Issue in the Next Scheduled or Currently Active Sprint. 
Or in a similar fashion with creating a new issue in an active sprint, popup a message should appear and ask if the user would like to add the reopened issue in the active/next sprint
 
h3. Workaround 
- In the Backlog, drag and drop the issue(s) onto the relevant sprint
or
- Edit the issue(s) and enter the sprint name in the Sprint field
fields.summary: Automatically Add Re-Opened Issue to Active Sprint

h4. Steps
 # Configure a board to use {{Queries}} in {{Card colors}}

h4. Expectation

No errors.

There's an error on the bottom of the page:
{code:java}
Exception: TypeError: that.field[0] is undefinedResource: http://ordinarypeople.syd.atlassian.com:8080/GHS-51939/s/e84aa6ae18c86f687885a93e0d9a7086-CDN/en_USgv4io4/71013/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/a615114f83cc11e95a6f8ed7030317e5/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,jira.global,gh-rapid-config,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&is-server-instance=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=trueLine: 126203Column: 17

{code}
{code:java}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'value' of undefined
{code}
!Screen Shot 2016-04-06 at 11.28.00.png|thumbnail!

Call stack:
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-06 at 11.32.40.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
I've searched the other issues, and I can't find anything similar.

Please implement a completely generic Kanban board.  By completely generic, I mean that:

* you can choose the "x axis" from any Jira field
* you can choose the "y axis" from any Jira field

Currently the "default" x axis is "Status", and the y axis is "Priority".

Judging from some of the other suggestions here, this would solve most of them.

Being able to create a kanban-style board with any choice of field for each axis would be extremely useful, e.g. by user (x-axis), and team (y-axis).  

We're currently using 'Mingle' which provides exactly this functionality, because Jira doesn't.
fields.summary: Completely generic Kanban board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Agile's Board, under _Active Sprint_ panel, there is a 'Switch Sprint' link. This link gives user the option to toggle which Active Sprint can be shown. This link is introduce in JIRA Software. For JIRA 6.x, there is no such link, instead, user can choose the active sprint directly by toggling the option as below.

*JIRA6.x*
 !Selection_146.png|thumbnail! 
*JIRA Software*
 !Selection_147.png|thumbnail! 

Previously, prior to JIRA 7 (JIRA 6.4.12), this toggle functionality will remember the active sprint chosen using this link when navigating to other boards and coming back to the original board, which it will still show the Active Sprint chosen previously, however, on JIRA Software, this is not the case. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 boards, Board A and Board B
# Create 2 active sprints
# In Board A, choose sprint 1
# Go to Board B
# Go back to Board A

h3. Expected Results
The link will remember the chosen active sprint previously, after moving from one board to another

h3. Actual Results
Active Sprint is showing 'All Sprints' instead when you went back to your original board
fields.summary: To make the 'switch sprint' functionality work as in previous JIRA

The default custom filter is *Open Issues*, which only displays all issues which has no Resolution set. Today, we are only able to sort the result in the list based on one field, however, we can't add a column to display a selected field.

h3. Suggestion
As a user, I would like to be able to add columns to display when using the custom filter like *Open Issues*, *My Open Issues* and etc.
 !Jira_Detail_View_Issue_List.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Click on the *View all issues and filters* link on the top right, it will direct us to the Issue Navigator page.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Consider either disabling this option if it is a no-op when no issue is selected, 
or when clicked, select an issue, then show it ?

Doing nothing feels wrong, especially during on-boarding/eval of the product when a user may be exploring all options/features/views .
fields.summary: "Show Detail View" menu item is confusing if no issue is selected

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
An error occured on our agile board on JIRA Cloud. It's a private board, so I don't know if the link to it is helpful: https://dfelten.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&useStoredSettings=true 

The tickets are working on the issue area, but the agile board isn't working anymore. I tried it with Firefox, Chrome and Edge in the current versions.

 !image-2016-04-02-11-48-08-335.png|thumbnail! 

Versions from the about page:
* JIRA V7.2.0-OD-05-022
* Portfolio for JIRA v1.12.4-OD-D20160322T001113
* Capture for JIRA v2.9.14.0048
* JIRA Agile v7.2.6-D20160330T044439

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Cumulative Flow Diagram is displaying incorrect data for certain issue statuses.
I use development workflow which contains an issue status "Development".
Nr of issues in that status differs in different view's of the board:
- Under "columns" view under Configure Board menu, the number displayed is "7" (i assume this is correct, cause I get the same result using assumed underlying JQL query - "project = SKISO AND status = Development"). See attached screenshot.
- Under Cumulative Flow diagram, the number visualized on the diagram is clearly "14" - see attached screenshot.

The expected number visualized on the board should be 7, because we clearly have 7 issues in development status in this project (also proved by the JQL query).
I can replicate this issue on other boards, projects and statuses. But in some statuses the data is  displayed correctly (it corresponds to data displayed on Configure Board/Columns view).
fields.summary: Incorrect data displayed in Cumulative Flow Diagram

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a sprint includes issues from different projects, users are not able to click on *Complete sprint* if they do not have *Manage sprints* permissions on all related projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Users want to include in the tooltip that "To complete a sprint, Manage Sprints permission should be granted in all projects that have been pulled into the sprint.". With this tooltip, they will be more likely to try fixing the issue first before contacting support.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be warned when my sprint includes issues from multiple projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
REST Request :
*/rest/agile/1.0/board/37/sprint?startAt=0&maxResults=50*

Returns reponse :

*{"errorMessages":["The board must be ordered by Rank in order to add a sprint"],"errors":{}}*

# Here I am just fetching Sprints for board 37 but error message is saying that I am trying to add sprint in this board which is not correct. REST query is just for fetching sprints.
# Even if RANK is disabled, I should be able to at least fetch Sprints via REST API.
fields.summary: Not able to fetch JIRA sprints for board when RANK query is disabled in filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a JIRA Software Project (Scrum, Kanban or Basic), if the Issue Types "Epic" or "Story" exist but are not of type "Standard" the project creation fails.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove Issue Types "Story" or "Epic" if they exist.
# Create an Issue Type called "Story" or "Epic" of type" "Sub-Task"
# Create a Scrum, Kanban or Basic Software project

h3. Expected Results
The project is created with either the same Issue Type that exists or a new one that meets the requirements. Else, a message on screens specifies the problem so it can be corrected.

h3. Actual Results
On the last step of the project creation, the following message is shown:
{quote}
Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of [JIRA Software 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+release+notes], when completing a Sprint, a popup will appear allowing the Admin to choose a Destination for Incomplete Issues if there are Sprints Scheduled.  By Default, the Backlog is Selected; in previous versions of JIRA Software (Agile), incomplete issues were automatically moved into the Next Scheduled Sprint. 

This causes a problem and a delay in workflow as the incomplete issues are moved back into the backlog and need to be found and manually moved into the next sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
If there are Scheduled Sprints, the Destination Selection should default to the Next Scheduled Sprint rather than the Backlog
 
h3. Workaround 
Ensure the Next Scheduled Sprint is selected before Completing current Sprint
fields.summary: Destination Selection When Completing a Sprint Should Default to Next Scheduled Sprint

fields.description:
This issue has occurred a few times, and it's very devious. It can be very hard to impossible to diagnose by the project admins, and it's caused by a very simple error. Here's how it happens:

# User 1 is project admin in project A, but not in project B. He doesn't even have Browse Issues rights, so project B and its issues are essentially invisible
# User 2 is project admin in project B, but not on project A
# User 1 uses a Scrum board and starts a sprint
# User 2 reports an issue in project B. That issue's Create screen contains the Sprint field, but User 2 makes a mistakes: He manually types in the wrong sprint, and inadvertantly add that new issue to the sprint for project A
# User 1 attempts to close his sprint, but is met with a problem: He's not admin of project B. Since he doesn't even have Browse Issue rights, he's not allowed to see the name of the project this intruder issue belongs to. 
# User 1 is smart and goes in Issues and filters for issues belonging to his sprint, but since he has no Browse Issues rights, he doesn't see the issue that's out of place.
# At this point, a JIRA admin has to get involved and must track down the problem. User 1 could not have found the problem, and user 2 couldn't have known about it until he was closing his own sprint and noticed the absence of an issue there.

If user 1 had been project admin on project B as well, the sprint would have closed without errors, but this would have been a worse outcome. User 2 would have had an issue disappear from his backlog because it would be part of a closed sprint, and user 1 would have weird sprint reports.

I see how this would be tricky to prevent. You would need a condition that "only issues that pass the filter for the board that created the sprint can be added to a sprint". Still, this seems like a huge problem area.
fields.summary: Project admin has an issue incorrectly added in his sprint and can't find which without a system admin

fields.description:
In JIRA Service Desk, you can set a default value for unsupported fields added to a request type.
As per GHS-12742 this now does not work in 7.0.0.
However, another problem is that testing with JIRA 6.4.10 with Agile 6.7.11 and Service Desk 2.5.8, the following is observed.
Reproduce
Start JIRA 6.4.10 with Agile and Service Desk plugins
Create a Service Desk project
Use a field screen that has Epic Link on the create screen
Go to Project Administration for service desk project -> Request Types
Edit fields for the request type
Add a new field (Epic Link)
Observe that it is added as a hidden field and requesting to preset a value
Click Edit value
Set a default value (may need to first create an Epic in the project, and add Epic to Issue Types)
Unable to render embedded object: File (epiclink-64.png) not found.
Now, when you create an issue through the customer portal.
Create issue as an agent for that Request Type from Customer Portal (the user you used to make the admin settings above) and observe that in JIRA view, the Epic Link has been set as expected
Now, create a Service Desk customer. Best method to do this is to Invite a Customer from the Project -> People page. Then follow the email to set password (or go to User Management and set a password)
Log in as this new customer only user to the Customer Portal and create an issue for the Request Type
Log in as an agent again, so can view issue in JIRA Issue View
Expected outcome
Like when performing the action as an agent, the Epic Link is set correctly for the user
Or -> If this is is not allowed (and you should be a JIRA User to set this field), then ensure that a FieldValidationException is thrown when validated
Actual outcome
The setting passes field validation, and is contained in the Issue Update when saved into JIRA, but when viewing the issue later, that value has silently failed to be actually saved.
Workaround
No workaround, except removing Epic Link from the request type fields
fields.summary: Epic Link custom field silently fails to set value

fields.description:
In any scrum Backlog, dragging and dropping an issue causes the entire backlog view to instantly scroll to the top. This is extremely frustrating when doing backlog grooming on a large backlog. Every time we reorder an item the page jumps to the top and we lose our spot in the backlog.

This is not the same problem as JSW-13159. In JSW-13159 the page is scrolling a little when you start dragging an item. In this issue the page immediately jumps to the top of the backlog, only when you drop an item, not while dragging it. Also unlike JSW-13159 this is happening 100% of the time, it is not intermittent.

I attached a video so you can see how this is different and worse than JSW-13159:
jira_JSW-13397_2016-03-22.mov
fields.summary: Scrum backlog jumps (scrolls instantly) to top whenever an issue is ranked via drag-drop

h3. Notes
This was previously reported as a Confluence bug here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-41160

Further testing though suggests that this is in fact a JIRA bug.  Customer on ticket GHS-37438 experienced this issue after upgrading from JIRA 7.0 to  7.1.2 while Confluence was on 5.8.13.  I tested this myself by installing Confluence 5.7.6 and testing and was able to replicate the problem while connected to JIRA 7.1.2

Tested as well with Confluence 5.7.6 and JIRA 7.0 and was not able to replicate.

No observed workaround at this time.

Currently, all resolution types are included in the total number of issues in burndowns, version reports, etc.

It would be useful to be able to choose which resolution types to be considered in reporting as some of them are just used to indicate no work was executed (i.e. Duplicate / Won't do / Someday).

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi
We all agree that a JIRA ticket would transition if its linked code reviews are reviewed and closed. If one of these code reviews is open, then the JIRA issue shouldn't be transitioned.
However, there is an issue (in my opinion) for it: What happens when a linked code review is at Draft, Abandoned or Summarized state? What it seems is that there is a code change committed against the ticket and its Crucible code review is created but is on Draft state. At the JIRA ticket side, there are transitions that shouldn't appear because of the code review is not closed regardless of being reviewed or not.

Is there a way that at JIRA workflow transition, set a condition that the ticket shouldn't be transitioned when at least one of the code reviews is open, draft, abandoned, or summarized.

Thanks
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow condition in terms of non open/closed code review statuses

fields.description:
In previous JIRA versions when viewing a JIRA issue, the Agile section would show the Epic that the issue was associated with.  We have just upgraded to JIRA 6.4.12 and see this is no longer the case.  We would like this feature added back.  This is when viewing an issue in JIRA, not on an Agile board.

See attachment for how it showed before.  We would like to have this available again.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing the backlog of an Agile board, the time estimation fields show estimation for the entire board. When clicking on a quick filter, the estimation fields should display based on the quick filter


h3. Environment
* Cloud version {{7.2.0-OD-04-029}}, Agile version {{7.2.3-D20160316T002614}}


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Ensure that the board is using Story Points for time estimation
# Create several issues
# Add time estimates to the issues
# Add issues to a sprint
# Start the sprint
# Create a quick filter that will only display a specific assignee
# Filter the backlog based on that quick filter


h3. Expected Results

The time estimation should display only time estimation based on the quick filter displayed


h3. Actual Results

The time estimation will continue to display the entire backlogs estimation

 
h3.Workaround

It is possible to use the time estimation gadget to display this information
This does require seperate filters as well as new filters per sprint
fields.summary: Time estimation fields not filtering estimation based on quick filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After upgrading to JIRA 7.1.2, JIRA do not store the last selected filters on rapid boards.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click Board
# Select a Scrum board
# Click configure -> Quick Filter. Configure a filter
# Go back to the previously selected board.
# Click on the newly created filter above the board. Please notice that the filter is highlighted with blue colour.
# Select any of the issue shown from the filter. 
# Click on the Issue Key from right side of the page. This will bring us to the Issue page.
# From the issue page, click Boards (top of the screen), select the previously selected Scrum board.
# Check the filter names and user will notice that the previously selected filter is not highlighted.

Screen Recording :  [^GHS-36936.webm] 

h3. Expected Results

* Previously used filter is highlighted

h3. Actual Results

* Previously used filter is not highlighted

h3.Workaround

User can use the back key from browser to navigate back to browser.
fields.summary: JIRA Board view last filter is no stored

fields.description:
When I create a new *Scrum Software Development* project it automatically creates a board associated with it. But when I create a new *Basic Software Development* project it doesn't create a board.

Questions:
# Is this a bug?
# Is there a place where the automatic creation of board with the project can be controlled?
fields.summary: Board automatically not/created with Project types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In previous versions, when applying a quick filter in the backlog view, the sum of all estimates shown in the top right corner would change to show the sum of only the visible issues:
 !image-2016-03-23-10-40-30-651.png|thumbnail! 

Now, applying a quick filter does not change these numbers:
 !image-2016-03-23-10-40-18-954.png|thumbnail! 

Based on your release notes, this change does not seem to have been intentional. The old behavior was very useful. For example, if I click a "My Work" filter, I could see at a glance how many points I have in my sprint.
fields.summary: In Backlog view, estimate sums no longer change when quick filters are applied

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating stories in Confluence pages using the 'Product Requirements' blueprint is not working if we link the issue to the Epic.

This is triggering errors in JIRA's log, so this seems to be a bug in JIRA.

h3. Environment
Affected version:
# JIRA v7.2.0-OD-04-029
# JIRA Agile v7.2.3-D20160316T002614
# 6.0.0-OD-2016.12.1-1106

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Software project and an Epic in it
# In Confluence correctly connected to this JIRA via Application Links, create a page using the 'Product Requirements' blueprint
# Edit the page and add a link to the Epic in the first table in the line where it says 'Epic', in the second column
# Save the page
# Select any text in the page and select the 'JIRA' icon to create an issue
# Enter the project and the story type
# Make sure the 'Link to epic' is select
# Click 'Create'

h3. Expected Results
The story is correctly created and linked to the Epic.

It keeps spinning and never never ends.
